Forms

Usage Guidelines

Forms are used to gather input from the user.

Apollo UI provides several form control styles, layout options, and custom components for creating a wide variety of forms.

Basic form

Use forms to collect information from users, such as contact information, status updates, or credentials.

HTML5 input types

Be sure to use the appropriate type attribute that corresponds to the type of information being collected (reference).

Form with grid

To make form labels appear alongside their corresponding controls, you can use grid columns and text alignment classes to create the desired layout. The column width for the labels and controls should be made to accommodate the length of your labels at each breakpoint. Labels should stack with controls for mobile screen sizes.

Available input controls

Several input controls are available to choose from. Each one has a specific intended use and offers unique interaction patterns that are familiar to users.

Input box
Checkbox
Checkbox on dark
Radio
Radio on dark
Select
Textarea

Toggle

The toggle control is a restyled version of a radio button and behaves the same way, so use it to allow users to choose a single value from two or more options.

Basic toggle
Dark toggle

Validation states

Give users inline visual feedback to indicate the status of their input.

Error message

Please enter a valid email address

Alternate markup

In cases where the validation state class needs to be applied diretly to the input control, use this modified markup.

Please enter a valid email address
